error.signature: MQTT connection failed: certificate not active or not attached to a thing/policy

verdict.summary: IoT device cannot connect because the certificate is inactive, not attached to a thing, or missing a policy.

dead_ends.action: Generate new certificates without deactivating the old ones
dead_ends.why_fails: Old certificates remain active and create security risk; new certs need same policy attachment

dead_ends.action: Use IAM credentials instead of certificates for IoT devices
dead_ends.why_fails: IoT Core primarily uses X.509 certificates for device auth; IAM is for management plane only

workarounds.action: Activate the certificate and attach it to both a thing and a policy
workarounds.how: aws iot update-certificate --certificate-id ID --new-status ACTIVE && aws iot attach-thing-principal && aws iot attach-policy

workarounds.action: Verify the IoT policy allows the required MQTT actions on the correct topic ARNs
workarounds.how: aws iot get-policy --policy-name POLICY to check iot:Connect, iot:Publish, iot:Subscribe, iot:Receive actions

leads_to.condition: Certificate is active but policy denies the specific action

preceded_by.condition: Thing or certificate resource was deleted but device still tries to connect

frequently_confused_with.distinction: AccessDenied is about IAM permission for API calls; IoT certificate error is about X.509 certificate-based device authentication
